User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686 on x86_64; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: 3.1.10

Taking as base the tags feature that I think is a very valued asset of thunderbird comparing to other e-mail clients, same color filtering could be applied having recipient type as a criteria. 

New feature that would help users to filter e-mails: allow (as an option) to colour e-mails in list depending if thunderbird configured recipient is in "To" field (main destination) or is in "CC" field. Something similar as it is done for tags.
Example:
if my e-mail is in "To" field -> email not colored in the list
if my e-mail is in "Cc" field -> email colored with a color I have configured


Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
N/A

Actual Results:  
N/A

Expected Results:  
N/A

comments.raw_text:
Can't this already be done via filters?

If you're struggling to create such a filter, I think you'd make one that matches "CC containing my@email.com" and the action would be "Tag Message CcToMe", substituting your email address and preferred tag, of course.
